Primary Executive: Dr. Edward Taylor, Associate Dean, Faculty of Health and Social Development, & Co-Chair Interprofessional Clinic, UBC Okanagan; Phone: 250.807.8740; Email: edward.taylor@ubc.ca
Service Details: - Focuses primarily on children, adolescents, and young adults with moderate to severe mental disorders- Graduate level UBC social work and Psychology clinical students, supervised by a senior experienced clinician at this teaching clinic, provide professional services that address mental, behavioural, emotional, family, and marital problems- With permission from parents, the clinic coordinates with schools, medical doctors and community agencies for clients- This is a collaborative venture between the School of Social Work (Faculty of Health and Social Development) and the Department of Psychology (Irving K. Barber School of Arts and Sciences)
Hours: - Hours based on appointments- Please email or call for more information or to arrange an appointment
Eligibility: Ages: 5 year(s) and upWorks primarily with children, adolescents, young adults, and families challenged by mental, behavioural, or emotional concerns.  However, arrangements can be made for service for adults facing moderate to severe mental disorders. The clinic also provides family and marital therapy for clients facing life problems that are not related to a mental disorder.
Cost: None; except for cost of parking
Address & Map: Arts Building, Room 3601147 Research RdKelowna, BC     V1V 1V7
